tool_description: API reference for the MapTiler Cloud services, allows you to programmatically access all the data, maps, and resources.
name: MapTiler Cloud API
title: MapTiler Cloud API

api_list.name: Bounds-based image
api_list.description: Generates a raster image based on the given bounds.

required_parameters.name: minx
required_parameters.description: Longitude of the left (west) edge.

required_parameters.name: mapId
required_parameters.description: Identifier of the map. See [MapTiler Cloud Maps](https://cloud.maptiler.com/maps/).

required_parameters.name: width
required_parameters.description: Width of the image in pixels.

optional_parameters.name: path
optional_parameters.description: Define path(s) to be drawn on top of the map. Can be used multiple times. See [https://support.maptiler.com/i26-static-maps-for-your-web](https://support.maptiler.com/i26-static-maps-for-your-web).

optional_parameters.name: latlng
optional_parameters.description: Use [latitude, longitude] order for coordinates instead of [longitude, latitude].

optional_parameters.name: markers
optional_parameters.description: Define marker(s) to be drawn on top of the map. Can be used multiple times. See [https://support.maptiler.com/i26-static-maps-for-your-web](https://support.maptiler.com/i26-static-maps-for-your-web).

optional_parameters.name: attribution
optional_parameters.description: Changes the position of map attribution. If you disable the attribution make sure to display it in your application yourself (visibly).

optional_parameters.name: width
optional_parameters.description: Width of the stroke line when drawing polygons (in pixels). Deprecated, use \"path\" instead.

optional_parameters.name: padding
optional_parameters.description: Ensures the autofitted bounds or features are comfortably visible in the resulting area. E.g. use 0.1 to add 10% margin (at least) of the size to each side.

optional_parameters.name: encodedpath
optional_parameters.description: Path in [Google Encoded Polyline Format](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/utilities/polylinealgorithm). Deprecated, use \"path\" instead.

optional_parameters.name: fill
optional_parameters.description: Color to use as a fill when drawing polygons. Deprecated, use \"path\" instead.

optional_parameters.name: stroke
optional_parameters.description: Color to use as a stroke when drawing polygons. Deprecated, use \"path\" instead.

api_list.name: Raster XYZ tiles
api_list.description: Rasterized tiles (XYZ) of the map. Can be used with various libraries to display a raster map (e.g. Leaflet, OpenLayers, ...). It's usually better (if possible) to use the TileJSON rather than using the tile URL directly.

required_parameters.name: mapId
required_parameters.description: Identifier of the map. See [MapTiler Cloud Maps](https://cloud.maptiler.com/maps/).

api_list.name: Map symbols (sprites)
api_list.description: Map symbols (sprites) required to display the vector map.

required_parameters.name: mapId
required_parameters.description: Identifier of the map. See [MapTiler Cloud Maps](https://cloud.maptiler.com/maps/).

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com/maps/streets/sprite{scale}.{format}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com/maps/{mapid}/sprite{scale}.{format}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: TileJSON
api_list.description: TileJSON describing the metadata of the map as well as link to the XYZ tiles. Can be used with various libraries to display a raster map (e.g. Leaflet, OpenLayers, ...).

required_parameters.name: mapId
required_parameters.description: Identifier of the map. See [MapTiler Cloud Maps](https://cloud.maptiler.com/maps/).

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com/maps/streets/{tileSize/}/tiles.json"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com/maps/{mapid}/{tileSize/}/tiles.json"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Transform coordinates
api_list.description: Transform coordinates

required_parameters.name: coordinates
required_parameters.description: List of coordinate pairs seperated by ; delimeter (Max 50 pairs).

optional_parameters.name: s_srs
optional_parameters.description: Source CRS

optional_parameters.name: ops
optional_parameters.description: List of codes of operations seperated by a | (pipe) operator

optional_parameters.name: t_srs
optional_parameters.description: Target CRS

transformer_selection_strategy.description: Transformations are selected using given `ops` parameter. If no parameter is given, `auto` strategy is used. If given, it may try to use a `listed` transformation, then fallback to `towgs84` patching, and finally `boundcrs`.

api_list.name: Auto-fitted image
api_list.description: Generates a raster image based on the given features. The area is calculated so that all the paths and markers given in query are visible.

required_parameters.name: width
required_parameters.description: Width of the image in pixels.

required_parameters.name: mapId
required_parameters.description: Identifier of the map. See [MapTiler Cloud Maps](https://cloud.maptiler.com/maps/).

optional_parameters.name: attribution
optional_parameters.description: Changes the position of map attribution. If you disable the attribution make sure to display it in your application yourself (visibly).

optional_parameters.name: stroke
optional_parameters.description: Color to use as a stroke when drawing polygons. Deprecated, use \"path\" instead.

optional_parameters.name: path
optional_parameters.description: Define path(s) to be drawn on top of the map. Can be used multiple times. See [https://support.maptiler.com/i26-static-maps-for-your-web](https://support.maptiler.com/i26-static-maps-for-your-web).

optional_parameters.name: markers
optional_parameters.description: Define marker(s) to be drawn on top of the map. Can be used multiple times. See [https://support.maptiler.com/i26-static-maps-for-your-web](https://support.maptiler.com/i26-static-maps-for-your-web).

optional_parameters.name: encodedpath
optional_parameters.description: Path in [Google Encoded Polyline Format](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/utilities/polylinealgorithm). Deprecated, use \"path\" instead.

optional_parameters.name: fill
optional_parameters.description: Color to use as a fill when drawing polygons. Deprecated, use \"path\" instead.

optional_parameters.name: padding
optional_parameters.description: Ensures the autofitted bounds or features are comfortably visible in the resulting area. E.g. use 0.1 to add 10% margin (at least) of the size to each side.

optional_parameters.name: latlng
optional_parameters.description: Use [latitude, longitude] order for coordinates instead of [longitude, latitude].

optional_parameters.name: width
optional_parameters.description: Width of the stroke line when drawing polygons (in pixels). Deprecated, use \"path\" instead.

api_list.name: Center-based image
api_list.description: Generates a raster image based on the specified center and zoom level.

required_parameters.name: width
required_parameters.description: Width of the image in pixels.

required_parameters.name: mapId
required_parameters.description: Identifier of the map. See [MapTiler Cloud Maps](https://cloud.maptiler.com/maps/).

required_parameters.name: lon
required_parameters.description: Longitude of the center of the image.

optional_parameters.name: latlng
optional_parameters.description: Use [latitude, longitude] order for coordinates instead of [longitude, latitude].

optional_parameters.name: fill
optional_parameters.description: Color to use as a fill when drawing polygons. Deprecated, use \"path\" instead.

optional_parameters.name: encodedpath
optional_parameters.description: Path in [Google Encoded Polyline Format](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/utilities/polylinealgorithm). Deprecated, use \"path\" instead.

optional_parameters.name: path
optional_parameters.description: Define path(s) to be drawn on top of the map. Can be used multiple times. See [https://support.maptiler.com/i26-static-maps-for-your-web](https://support.maptiler.com/i26-static-maps-for-your-web).

optional_parameters.name: attribution
optional_parameters.description: Changes the position of map attribution. If you disable the attribution make sure to display it in your application yourself (visibly).

optional_parameters.name: markers
optional_parameters.description: Define marker(s) to be drawn on top of the map. Can be used multiple times. See [https://support.maptiler.com/i26-static-maps-for-your-web](https://support.maptiler.com/i26-static-maps-for-your-web).

optional_parameters.name: width
optional_parameters.description: Width of the stroke line when drawing polygons (in pixels). Deprecated, use \"path\" instead.

optional_parameters.name: stroke
optional_parameters.description: Color to use as a stroke when drawing polygons. Deprecated, use \"path\" instead.

api_list.name: Tiles - TileJSON
api_list.description: TileJSON describing the metadata of the tiles as well as link to the XYZ tiles. Can be used with various libraries to display the tiles (e.g. Leaflet, OpenLayers, ...).

required_parameters.name: tilesId
required_parameters.description: Identifier of the tiles. See [MapTiler Cloud Tiles](https://cloud.maptiler.com/tiles/).

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com/tiles/satellite/tiles.json"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com/tiles/{tilesid}/tiles.json"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Search coordinate systems
api_list.description: Search coordinate systems

required_parameters.name: query
required_parameters.description:
Query string used to search the catalog. It accepts plain terms such as names of locations and key:value pairs for filtering.

Following parameter values can be used:
- kind
    - \\\\* (All kinds)
    - CRS (All coordinate reference systems - default)
        - CRS-PROJCRS (Projected coordinate systems)
        - CRS-GEOGCRS (Geodetic coordinate systems)
        - CRS-GEOG3DCRS (Geodetic 3D coordinate systems)
        - CRS-GCENCRS (Geocentric coordinate systems)
        - CRS-VERTCRS (Vertical coordinate systems)
        - CRS-ENGCRS (Engineering coordinate systems)
        - CRS-COMPOUNDCRS (Compound coordinate systems)
        - CRS-DRVDCRS (Derived coordinate systems)
    - COORDOP (All operations)
        - COORDOP-COPTRAN (Transformations)
        - COORDOP-COPCONO (Compound operations)
        - COORDOP-POIMOTO (Point motion operations)
        - COORDOP-COPCON (Conversions)
    - DATUM (All datums)
        - DATUM-VERTDAT (Vertical datums)
        - DATUM-ENGDAT (Engineering datums)
        - DATUM-GEODDAT (Geodetic datums)
        - DATUM-DYNGEODDA (Dynamic geodetic datums)
        - DATUM-ENSEMDAT (Ensemble datum)
    - ELLIPSOID (Ellipsoid)
    - PRIMEM (Prime meridian)
    - METHOD (Method / Projection)
    - CS (Coordinate systems)
        - CS-VERTCS (Vertical coordinate system)
        - CS-SPHERCS (Spherical coordinate system)
        - CS-CARTESCS (Cartesian coordinate system)
        - CS-ELLIPCS (Ellipsoidal coordinate system)
        - CS-AFFINE (Affine coordinate system)
        - CS-ORDINAL (Ordinal coordinate system)
    - AXIS (Axis)
    - AREA (Area)
    - UNIT (Unit)
        - UNIT-ANGUNIT (Angle unit)
        - UNIT-SCALEUNIT (Scale unit)
        - UNIT-LENUNIT (Length unit)
        - UNIT-TIMEUNIT (Time unit)
- code
    - Full code of the resource
- trans
    - Code of the transformation
- deprecated
    - \\\\* (Both active and deprecated)
    - 0 (active only - default)
    - 1 (deprecated only)

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned

optional_parameters.name: exports
optional_parameters.description: Show exports in WKT and Proj4 notations

optional_parameters.name: transformations
optional_parameters.description: Show detailed transformations for each CRS

bbox.description: Bounding box of the resource in [min_lon, min_lat, max_lon, max_lat] order.
bbox.title: Bbox

default_transformation.description: Most suitable transformation for this CRS.
default_transformation.title: Default Transformation

bbox.description: Bounding box of the resource in [min_lon, min_lat, max_lon, max_lat] order.
bbox.title: Bbox

grids.description: List of grids used in this operation.
grids.title: Grids

reversible.description: Whether this operation can be used in reverse or not.
reversible.title: Reversible

usable.description: Whether this operation can be used in online API or not.
usable.title: Usable

api_list.name: IP Geolocation
api_list.description: Obtain information about visitor's location based on IP address of the incoming request.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com/geolocation/ip.json"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com/geolocation/ip.json"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "maptiler-cloud-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

country_bounds.description: Bounds of the country in WGS84 degrees `[west, south, east, north]`.

country_languages.description: Official country languages in ISO 639-1 format.

eu.description: Indicated whether the country is part of the European Union.

region.description: If known, the ISO 3166-2 name for the first level region.

region_code.description: If known, the ISO 3166-2 code for the first level region.

api_list.name: Style JSON of the map
api_list.description: Style JSON describing the map cartography. Can be used with various libraries to display a vector map (e.g. Mapbox GL JS, OpenLayers, ...).

required_parameters.name: mapId
required_parameters.description: Identifier of the map. See [MapTiler Cloud Maps](https://cloud.maptiler.com/maps/).

        }

print(response.json())

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Search by coordinates (reverse)
api_list.description: Reverse geocoding (search by coordinates).

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description: Prefer results in specific language. One or more [ISO 639-1 codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), separated by commas to be displayed. Only the first language code is used when prioritizing forward geocode results to be matched.

schema.description: Search result represented by FeatureCollection where every item is represented as a GeoJSON Feature
schema.title: SearchResults

bbox.description: Bounding box of the original feature as `[w, s, e, n]` array
bbox.title: bbox

center.description: A `[lon, lat]` array of the original feature centeroid
center.title: coordinates

place_name.description: Formatted (including the hierarchy) and localized feature full name

api_list.name: XYZ tiles
api_list.description: The individual tiles. Can be used with various libraries to display the tiles (e.g. Leaflet, OpenLayers, ...). It's usually better (if possible) to use the TileJSON rather than using the tile URL directly.

required_parameters.name: tilesId
required_parameters.description: Identifier of the tiles. See [MapTiler Cloud Tiles](https://cloud.maptiler.com/tiles/).

api_list.name: Search by name (forward)
api_list.description: Forward geocoding (search by place name).

required_parameters.name: query
required_parameters.description: Place name to search for.

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description: Prefer results in specific language. One or more [ISO 639-1 codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), separated by commas to be displayed. Only the first language code is used when prioritizing forward geocode results to be matched.

optional_parameters.name: proximity
optional_parameters.description: A `[lon, lat]` array to use for biasing search results. Specify to prefer results close to a specific location - features closer to the proximity value will be given priority over those further from the proximity value.

optional_parameters.name: bbox
optional_parameters.description: A `[w, s, e, n]` bbox array to use for limiting search results. Only features inside the provided bbox will be included.

schema.description: Search result represented by FeatureCollection where every item is represented as a GeoJSON Feature
schema.title: SearchResults

bbox.description: Bounding box of the original feature as `[w, s, e, n]` array
bbox.title: bbox

center.description: A `[lon, lat]` array of the original feature centeroid
center.title: coordinates

place_name.description: Formatted (including the hierarchy) and localized feature full name

api_list.name: Font glyphs
api_list.description: Generates the glyphs for the requested fonts. Used when displaying vector maps.

required_parameters.name: fontstack
required_parameters.description: Font name, or more comma-separated names.

required_parameters.name: start
required_parameters.description: Start of the glyph range.
